head.supplied: ¶ [The superintendent of our public garden, has received a communication from Dr. Mueller, advising on the authority of Captain Pasley, that provision will be made, under the head of public recreatio...

div.p:
Letter not found. For the text given here, see the Geelong advertiser, 27 January 1858. The letter is dated to January 1858 on the basis that it would be betweeen the petition from the inhabitants of Geelong presented by Dr Thomson on 6 January 1858 to the Victorian Legislative Assembly praying that a sum of money be placed upon the Estimates for the maintenance of their Botanic Gardens and Park. See Victoria, Legislative Assembly (1858) Votes and proceedings, 6 January, Melbourne; and G. Jones (1984).
[The superintendent of our public garden, has received a communication from Dr. Mueller, advising on the authority of Captain Pasley, that provision will be made, under the head of public recreation, for the maintenance of the gardens during the current year. The performance of this assurance will relieve the public mind of painful apprehension, and conferring a great boon will save what by withdrawal of support would only be, a waste of public funds.]
